response.response:
These scripts are meant to be used with the macOS tool Raycast. Each script performs a different action related to browsing the internet:

1. `open-in-guest-profile.sh`: Opens the current website in a guest profile/mode.
2. `shorten-url-bitly.template.sh`: Shortens a URL using Bitly.
3. `shlink-create-short-url.template.sh`: Creates a short URL using Shlink.
4. `shorten-url.sh`: Shortens a URL using TinyURL.
5. `go-to-outine.sh`: Opens a website in Outline mode.
6. `open-multiple-websites-on-safari.template.sh`: Opens multiple websites in Safari.
7. `to-private-browsing.sh`: Opens the current site in a private browser.
8. `safari-current-window-urls.applescript`: Copies all URLs from the frontmost Safari window.
9. `git-io.sh`: Shortens any github.com URL.
10. `website-screenshots.sh`: Takes screenshots of a given URL.
11. `new-browser-window.sh`: Opens a new window in the default browser.
12. `peekalink.template.sh`: Uses the Peekalink.io API to peek at a specified URL.
13. `short-url-emoji.sh`: Transforms a URL into a short Emoji URL.
14. `Youtube Shorts in video player.sh`: Opens a YouTube Shorts video in the normal video player.
15. `open-chrome-without-cors.sh`: Opens Chrome with web security option disabled.
16. `safari-current-page-url.sh`: Copies the URL of the currently opened page in Safari.
17. `chrome-current-page-url.sh`: Copies the URL of the currently opened page in Chrome.
18. `convert-twitter-to-nitter.js`: Converts a Twitter link to a Nitter link. 

To use any of these scripts, you would need to install Raycast and then add the script to your Raycast scripts directory.
